item.title: Trying Hyprland instead of X11
item.description: Short Post - I tried Hyprland today and for some reason it provides an even better battery backup on my laptop. I knew configuring X11 is tricky as it's very old. It didn't even take me 30 mins to configure the same Qtile keybindings which I struggled for so long, audio …
item.dc:creator: khirod

item.title: Implemented binary search trees in golang today
item.description: I've been skipping writing because I was rather drunk on weekends. Today I decided to implement binary search trees in golang, because I always struggle with binary search tree style questions during interviews (another nemesis of mine are arrays with greedy solutions). It's high time I start working on taking …
item.dc:creator: khirod

item.title: external monitor setup with qtile, x11 on arch linux
item.description: I was thinking of how to use an external monitor in the vertical setup, although I was able to achieve the intented setup a little bit, I'm still not sure how I am going to use it Haha. But I also learnt a lot about Qtile api and how things …
item.dc:creator: khirod

item.title: How to copy from vim to global clipboard on linux
item.description: Having installed arch linux again, I am going back to vim style of editing the files. I use neovim specifically and recently I struggled with how to yank lines from your editor to a global clipboard. This is needed at times when you want to copy something from your editor …
item.dc:creator: khirod

item.title: Day 2 of learning golang with leetcode
item.description: I managed to solve 3 simple implementation problems today, all 3 related to string manipulation of some kind. I used the most brute force way to solve the problems, however I should check out the leetcode pattern for string problems. The thing is, I didn't want to go too quickly …
item.dc:creator: khirod

item.title: noob golang dev - strings are hell, loops are amazing in golang
item.description: I have started practicing the leetcode Programming Skills study plan. To grasp a language quickly, it has progressive set of exercises. I started with a problem where you were given two strings and you had to merge them alternatively, eg - word1 - "Hello" and word2 - "World" then the function should return …
item.dc:creator: khirod
